item.title: Road regularly floods, 12th January
item.description:
I do not have a current photo due to driving at the time. Kerbside drainage does not appear to drain road adequately to adjacent ditches. It is a real problem for vehicles moving out into middle of the road to avoid the deep standing water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury

item.title: Poplar tree with crack at the base, 12th January
item.description:
Adjacent to GL50 4PD Large Poplar has a crack in the soil approx 6 inches wide and over 12inches deep, extending for approx 10feet on the south side of the tree. Suggesting that the root ball has moved. Mistakingly reported to CBC
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swindon Lane, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.title: Dog waste not picked up, 12th January
item.description:
Someone has allowed their dog to defecate on a footpath and not bothered to tidy up. People not prepared to clean up after their animals should not have pets. Itâ€™s unhygienic, disgusting and rude. This is a repeat event in this area.

item.title: Road markings severely faded, 12th January
item.description:
It's really difficult to see the road markings at night, particularly when it's damp. This has led to the car in front of me slamming on its brakes when a car approaches from the other direction on several occasions. As well as the lines in the centre of the road, it'd be worth putting lines on the outside of the road to aid visibility. I reported this a while ago and was told it would be fixed last year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Road marking white lines or studs

item.title: Roadworks causing 45 minute delays and lights are not detecting cars, 12th January
item.description:
The roadworks are very poorly positioned blocking 2 lanes of traffic with 3 way lights. The roads blocked by the roadworks are the only entrance and exit from the Oakley housing estate and the resulting backed up traffic on Priors Rd, Hale Rd and Hewlett Rd mean there is no route to and from the estate not blocked by traffic. The traffic caused by this one set of lights is frequently over 30 mins and has been over 45 mins which is wholly unacceptable. The lights on Redmarley Rd are malfunctioning and only letting 2 or 3 cars out on the sequence and are at times not even detecting cars which is causing additional unnecessary delays. There were no notice signs posted in advance of works starting and there are no signs up showing how long the works are scheduled for
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 186, Whaddon Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
